monster.name: Agog
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but does not speak

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The agog makes one Claw attack and one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the Prone condition.

action.name: Gobble (Bonus Action)
action.text: The agog makes a Bite attack against a Prone target.

monster.description:
This horrific thing has no shape or body resembling anything from the Mortal World. It roughly resembles a tree stump with four root-like legs each ending in a misshapen hoof. It has a wet, mottled, bark-like hide, and sprouting from the side of it like branches are knobbly arms ending in sharp claws. The top of its body is a gaping, tooth-filled mouth. It is shovelling chunks of horse-flesh into itself, and giggling as it swallows the ripped flesh. Whatever passes for arms, on the inside of the palm are yellow eyes.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Agog, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Climbing Aberration. You know the creature's type, and movement speeds. (10+) Attack the Fallen. You are aware of the creature's Gobble Bonus Action. (15+) Dim but Sturdy. You recognize the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics The Agog barrels towards its enemies, flailing its arms towards them and attempting to grab them and toss them to the ground. If it knocks a creature down, it will immediately begin attempting to devour them.
Source: Sebastian Crowes Terror in Tierhaven p. 18 (Third Party), Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 292 (Third Party)

monster.name: Allopine
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but does not speak

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
trait.text: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
trait.text: As an action, the creature can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Alien Intellect
trait.text: The monster is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the creature's intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The allopine makes three Quill attacks.

action.name: Quill
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing Damage.

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The allopine takes the Disengage or Hide action.

monster.description:
This creature has gaunt and misshapen form, with the scaled body, tail, and head of an alligator, bony spokes covering its body like a porcupine, batlike wings, and long, spindly limbs.
Study the Foe Characters proficient in History or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine an Allopine, learning the following based on the result. (5+) Flying Aberration. You know the creature's type, and movement speeds. (10+) Shifty. You are aware of the creature's Nimble Escape Bonus Action. (15+) Agile but Meek. They learn the creature's highest and lowest ability scores.
Combat Tactics Allopines are not warriors, but they are hostile to creatures who enter their territory and will fire Quills at anyone who comes too close. They do not stick around in a fight by themselves, and if they are with a flock, they will prefer to take to the air and fire Quills from afar.
Source: Sebastian Crowes Terror in Tierhaven p. 18 (Third Party), Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 293 (Third Party)
